metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5717 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the Linux kernel's Linux KernelPerformance Events (perf) component can be exploited to achieve localprivilege escalation. If perf_read_group() is called while an event'ssibling_list is smaller than its child's sibling_list, it can increment orwrite to memory locations outside of the allocated buffer. We recommendupgrading past commit 32671e3799ca2e4590773fd0e63aaa4229e50c06.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5717` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-39-generic - 6.2.0-39.40
linux-image-6.2.0-39-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-39.40
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-39-generic - 6.2.0-39.40
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-39-generic-64k - 6.2.0-39.40
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1018-kvm - 6.2.0-1018.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-aws - 6.2.0-1017.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1018-azure - 6.2.0-1018.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1020-gcp - 6.2.0-1020.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1018-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1018.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1018-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1018.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-oracle - 6.2.0-1017.18
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1018-raspi - 6.2.0-1018.20
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1010-starfive - 6.2.0-1010.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-39.40').
linux-kvm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1018.18').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1017.17').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1018.18').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1020.22').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1018.18').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1017.18').
linux-raspi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1018.20').
linux-starfive package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1010.11').
